post.summary: Add users to a rule's watch list
post.description:
Note that the added users could become either included included or excluded from the rule, depending on the rule's configuration.
This command requires a userIdFromAuthority to be associated with the user aliases for successful removal. Some users, such as ones added from the Code42 console or CLI do not have this id associated and cannot be removed with this API command. See our [support docs](https://support.code42.com/Cloud/Monitoring_and_managing/Manage_security_alerts_with_the_Code42_API) for more information on this id.

post.summary: Search for audit events

parameters.description: Finds events whose type is one of the given types.
parameters.name: eventTypes

parameters.description: Finds events whose actor_id is one of the given ids. An actor may be a human user or a service.
parameters.name: actorIds

parameters.description: Finds events whose actor_name is one of the given names. An actor may be a human user or a service.
parameters.name: actorNames

parameters.description: Finds events whose actor_ip_address is one of the given IP addresses.
parameters.name: actorIpAddresses

parameters.description:
Finds events whose affected_user_id is one of the given user ids. Only some event types have an
affected user. When this argument is given, event types that don't have an affected user will not be found.
parameters.name: affectedUserIds

parameters.description:
Finds events whose affected_user_name is one of the given names. A user may be impacted by
an event directly (e.g. user deactivated), or indirectly (e.g. device deactivated). Only some event types
include an affected user. When this argument is given, event types that don't have an affected user will not be found.
parameters.name: affectedUserNames

parameters.description: Which page of events to view.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: How many elements to return on each page.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Filters searchable events that match either actor or affected_user type
parameters.name: userTypes

events.description: A list of zero or more events matching the given criteria.

paginationRangeEndIndex.description: The index of the last result returned, in relation to total results found

paginationRangeStartIndex.description: The index of the first result returned, in relation to total results found

post.description:
General purpose audit-log search. All parameters are optional. A search with no arguments returns all events
to which the searching user has access.

A search with multiple values for a single parameter applies "or" logic for that parameter.
e.g. Searching for "actor_name=[alice@example.com, bob@example.com]" finds events for which either alice or bob was the actor.

A search with multiple parameters applies "and" logic between parameters.
e.g. Searching for "event_type=user_registered,actor_name=alice@example.com" finds user_registered events for which alice@example.com was the actor.

post.summary: Export search results to a file

parameters.description: Finds events whose type is one of the given types.
parameters.name: eventTypes

parameters.description: Finds events whose actor_id is one of the given ids. An actor may be a human user or a service.
parameters.name: actorIds

parameters.description: Finds events whose actor_name is one of the given names. An actor may be a human user or a service.
parameters.name: actorNames

parameters.description: Finds events whose actor_ip_address is one of the given IP addresses.
parameters.name: actorIpAddresses

parameters.description:
Finds events whose affected_user_id is one of the given user ids. Only some event types have an
affected user. When this argument is given, event types that don't have an affected user will not be found.
parameters.name: affectedUserIds

parameters.description:
Finds events whose affected_user_name is one of the given names. A user may be impacted by
an event directly (e.g. user deactivated), or indirectly (e.g. device deactivated). Only some event types
include an affected user. When this argument is given, event types that don't have an affected user will not be found.
parameters.name: affectedUserNames

parameters.description: Which page of events to view.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: How many elements to return on each page.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Filters export events that match either actor or affected_user type
parameters.name: userTypes

post.description: Perform an export of the data, getting back a download token that can be redeemed to get the actual file.

parameters.description: Download token to execute an export, acquired from the export api.
parameters.name: downloadToken

events.description: A list of zero or more events matching the given criteria.

paginationRangeEndIndex.description: The index of the last result returned, in relation to total results found

paginationRangeStartIndex.description: The index of the first result returned, in relation to total results found

get.description: Executes a search based on a download token from the export api.

parameters.description: Finds events whose type is one of the given types.
parameters.name: eventTypes

parameters.description: Finds events whose actor_id is one of the given ids. An actor may be a human user or a service.
parameters.name: actorIds

parameters.description:
Finds events whose affected_user_id is one of the given user ids. Only some event types have an

parameters.description:
Finds events whose affected_user_name is one of the given names. A user may be impacted by

include an affected user. When this argument is given, event types that don't have an affected user will not be found.

totalResultCount.description: The total number of results found by this search

post.description:
Returns the count of events found in a search with identical parameters and at the same time.
Parameters follow an identical behavior for this results count query, as they would the search query

get.summary: Get all cases for a tenant

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: User UID of an assignee of a case on which to filter.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Filter cases created between the supplied start and end times. Must use ISO time interval, for example: 2020-08-31T11:00:00Z/2020-09-01T15:30:00Z

parameters.name: isAssigned
parameters.description: Filter cases with an assignee (true) or without (false)

parameters.name: lastModifiedBy
parameters.description: User UID of the user who most recently modified the case.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of a case on which to filter; will include partial matches

parameters.name: pgNum
parameters.description: Page number for results, starting at 1.

parameters.name: pgSize
parameters.description: Max number of results to return for a page.

parameters.name: srtDir
parameters.description: The direction on which to sort the response, based on the corresponding key.

parameters.name: srtKey
parameters.description: One or more values on which the response will be sorted.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: One or more case statuses on which to filter.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: User UID of a subject of a case on which to filter.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Filter cases last updated between the supplied start and end times. Must use ISO time interval, for example: 2020-08-31T11:00:00Z/2020-09-01T15:30:00Z

200.description: Success: Response containing cases matching provided filters.

400.description: Bad Request: An invalid value was provided for a filter.

get.description: Most APIs require a Bearer token to be submitted in order to determine the calling user's identity and permissions. Call this endpoint with your user's basic authentication credentials to retrieve its Bearer token.
Some APIs require a tenant ID to be submitted to retrieve or edit Code42 data. Call this endpoint to retrieve the tenant ID to use for those APIs.

parameters.name: active

parameters.name: blocked

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: Direction of sort. ASC or DESC (case is irrelevant).

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of devices to return in the response.

ruleId.description: The unique identifier representing the rule you want to act upon.

users.description:
List of users to being watched in the rule.
Note that a userIdFromAuthority value of "Null UserIdFromAuthority.  These usernames must be edited in the web app."indicates that the user alias must be edited via the Code42 console or the Code42 CLI.

UsersToAlertOn-alert-rules.description: Possible users list config values for a rule.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

ruleId.description: The unique identifier representing the rule you want to act upon.

rules.description: List of rule details returned from the query.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the rule was created.

createdBy.description: Username of the individual who created the rule.

modifiedAt.description: Timestamp of when the rule was last modified.

modifiedBy.description: Username of the individual who last modified the rule.

isSystem.description: Boolean indicator of if the rule is a system rule.

watchMicrosoftOneDrive.description: Watch configuration for microsoft one drive.

publicOnTheWeb.description: Boolean indicating whether to alert on public on the web shares.

publicViaLink.description: Boolean indicating whether to alert on public via link shares.

outsideTrustedDomains.description: Boolean indicating whether to alert on outside trusted domains shares.

publicViaLink.description: Boolean indicating whether to alert on public via link shares.

outsideTrustedDomains.description: Boolean indicating whether to alert on outside trusted domains shares.

publicViaLink.description: Boolean indicating whether to alert on public via link shares.

outsideTrustedDomains.description: Boolean indicating whether to alert on outside trusted domains shares.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

description.example: Alert me on all removable media exfiltration.

isEnabled.description: Boolean indicating if the rule is currently enabled.

ruleSource.description: Indicates source of rule creation.  Either alerting or lens application name.

SeverityRating-alert-rules.description: Possible severity values for a rule.

usersToAlertOn.description: Indicates setting of how to interact with user list.

userList.description: List of users who's activity is specified as either watching or excluding from watching.

enabled.description: Boolean indicating if the notifications are turned on.

notificationAddress.description: Address notifications are configured to send to.

watchAllFiles.description: Boolean indicating if rule is watching all file categories.

fileCategoryList.description: List of file categories to watch.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

ruleIds.description: The unique identifiers representing the rules you want to act upon.

rules.description: List of rule details returned from the query.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the rule was created.

createdBy.description: Username of the individual who created the rule.

modifiedAt.description: Timestamp of when the rule was last modified.

modifiedBy.description: Username of the individual who last modified the rule.

isSystem.description: Boolean indicator of if the rule is a system rule.

fileSizeAndCount.description: File size and count watch configuration.

fileActivityIs.description: Type of file activity the rule is watching.

timeWindow.description: How long of a period for the activity to aggregate to hit the specified file size and count thresholds.

fileCountGreaterThan.description: Number of files exfiltrated within time window for alert to trigger.

totalSizeGreaterThanInBytes.description: Size of total files exfiltrated within time window for alert to trigger.

operator.description: Operator to use to combine size and count threshold.

Operator-alert-rules.description: Operators to use in file size and count configuration.

syncedToCloudService.description: Cloud services to watch for alerts.

uploadedOnRemovableMedia.description: Boolean indicating if we are watching removable media uploads.

readByBrowserOrOther.description: Boolean indicating if we are watching browser read activity.

watchBox.description: Boolean indicating if we are watching for box cloud sync activity.

watchBoxDrive.description: Boolean indicating if we are watching for box drive cloud sync activity.

watchDropBox.description: Boolean indicating if we are watching for drop box cloud sync activity.

watchGoogleBackupAndSync.description: Boolean indicating if we are watching for google backup and sync cloud sync activity.

watchAppleIcLoud.description: Boolean indicating if we are watching for apple iCloud sync activity.

watchMicrosoftOneDrive.description: Boolean indicating if we are watching for microsoft one drive cloud sync activity.

isSystem.description: Boolean indicator of if the rule is a system rule.

note.description: The note to attach to the alert.

alerts.description: List of alerts that are returned.

totalCount.description: The number of alerts that match the given query.

problems.description: Potential issues that were hit while trying to run the query.

id.description: The unique id of the alert.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the alert was created.

state.description: The current state of the alert.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

type.description: Rule type that generated the alert.

name.description: The name of the alert.  Same as the name of the rule that triggered it.

description.description: The description of the alert.  Same as the description of the rule that triggered it.
description.example: Alert me on all removable media exfiltration.

actor.description: The user who triggered the alert.

actorId.description: The authority user id who triggered the alert, if it is available.

severity.description: Indicates static rule severity of the alert.

riskSeverity.description: Indicates event risk severity of the alert.

notificationInfo.description: Notification information of the alert.  Not queried/returned.

ruleId.description: The unique id corresponding to the rule which triggered the alert.

ruleSource.description: Indicates source of rule creation.  Either alerting or lens application name.

SeverityRating-alerts.description: Possible severity values for an alert.

badFilter.description: The filter that caused the issue.

ProblemType-alerts.description: Potential issues when running a query on alerts.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

groupClause.description: The clause to use when combining group filters.  Must be AND/OR.

pgSize.description: The number of items to return in one request.  Value must be between 0 and 100.

pgNum.description: The page number to return. Page 0 is the first page of results.

srtKey.description: The alert attribute to sort by.  Value must be one of: AlertId, TenantId, Type, Name, Description, Actor, ActorId, Target, Severity, RiskSeverity, RuleSource, CreatedAt, Observations, Notes, State, StateLastModifiedAt, StateLastModifiedBy, LastModifiedTime, LastModifiedBy, RuleId

filters.description: The list of search filters to query on.

term.description:
The alert or rule metadata attribute to search on.

For alert queries, value must be one of: AlertId, TenantId, Type, Name, Description, Actor, ActorId, Target, Severity, RiskSeverity, RuleSource, CreatedAt, Observations, Notes, State, StateLastModifiedAt, StateLastModifiedBy, LastModifiedTime, LastModifiedBy, RuleId.

For rule queries, value must be one of RuleMetadataId, TenantId, ObserverRuleId, Type, Name, Description, Severity, IsSystem, IsEnabled, RuleSource, ModifiedAt, ModifiedBy, CreatedAt, CreatedBy, LogString.

value.description: The value you want to use in the filter.

SearchClause-alerts.description: The filter clause to use when combining the search filters.  Must be AND/OR.s

SortDirection-alerts.description: The sort direction applied to the returned page of alerts.

alerts.description: The alerts returned by the details query.

observations.description: Observation list included on the alert.

note.description: Most recent note added to the alert.

observedAt.description: Timestamp of when the observation was observed.

type.description: The type of observation data recorded.

data.description: The JSON formatted observation data rolled into one aggregation.

lastModifiedAt.description: Timestamp of when the note was last modified.

lastModifiedBy.description: User who last modified the note.

isEnabled.description: Boolean indicating if the rule is enabled to trigger alerts.

modifiedBy.description: Username of the individual who last modified the rule.

tenantId.description: The unique identifier representing the tenant.

groupClause.description: The clause to use when combining group filters.  Must be AND/OR.

pgSize.description: The number of items to return in one request.  Value must be between 0 and 100.

DateRange-audit.description: Range of date, inclusive of its endpoints. If both "start_time" and "end_time" are missing, the range includes all time.

Event-audit.description:
The base value for all auditable actions or observations taken, caused or invoked by an actor.
All audit log events must inherit from this type.

actor_agent.description: A text description of the web browser or other client application used by an actor to cause an event.

actor_id.description: The unique id of the user or system that caused the event.

actor_name.description: The name associated with a Code42 user account. For example: john.smith@example.com.

actor_type.description: The type of actor or affected user account coming from the customer-directory-definition

timestamp.description: The date and time of the event.

problem.description: The type of problem that occured

assignee.description: The user UID of the administrator assigned to investigate the case.

description.description: Brief description providing context for a case.

findings.description: Markdown formatted text summarizing the findings for a case.

name.description: The unique name given to the case.

subject.description: The user UID of the subject being investigated in this case.

problem.description: The type of problem that occured.

eventId.description: The unique identifier for the event.

eventTimestamp.description: Date and time that the Code42 service on the device detected an event; based on the device’s system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

exposure.description: Lists indicators that the data may be exposed.

fileName.description: The name of the file, including the file extension.

filePath.description: The file location on the user's device; a path forward or backslash should be included at the end of the filepath. Possibly null if the file event occurred on a cloud provider.

riskScore.description: Sum of the weights for each risk indicator. This score is used to determine the overall risk severity of the event.

riskSeverity.description: The general risk assessment of the event, based on the numeric score.

cases.description: List of cases in the response

totalCount.description: Total number of cases matching the provided filters

events.description: List of event IDs corresponding to events to be added to the case.

status.description:
Indicates the status of the case.
OPEN: The case is active and all aspects of the case are editable.
CLOSED: The case is resolved. Closed cases cannot be re-opened or modified. Case data for closed cases is retained indefinitely.

active.description: True means the device will show up on reports, etc.

blocked.description: True means device continues backing up, but restores and logins are disabled.

columns.description: Which columns to include in the output. If none is provided, all available columnswill be output in an unspecified, not-guaranteed order.

groupClause.description: Grouping clause for any specified groups.  Default is `AND`.

groups.description: One or more FilterGroups to be combined in a query.

error.description: Error indicating why the field could not be determined.

field.description: FileEvent field that could not be determined.

value.description: The classification value applied to the file.

vendor.description: The name of the vendor that classified the file.

actor.description: Name of the user reported by the cloud provider for the user who performed this file activity.

cloudDriveId.description: Unique identifier reported by the cloud provider for the drive containing the file at the time the event occurred.

createTimestamp.description: File creation timestamp as reported by the device's operating system in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC); available for Mac and Windows NTFS devices only.

destinationCategory.description: General category of where the file was sent. For example: Cloud Storage, Email, Social Media.

destinationName.description: Specific target of where the file was sent. For example: Google Drive, Outlook, Slack.

detectionSourceAlias.description: Name provided by a Code42 Customer Cloud Administrator when a Cloud Connector is initially configured.

deviceUid.description: Unique identifier for the device. Null if the file event occurred on a cloud provider.

deviceUserName.description: The Code42 username used to sign in to the Code42 app on the device. Null if the file event occurred on a cloud provider.

directoryId.description: Unique identifiers of the parent drives that contain the file; searching on directoryId will return events for all of the files contained in the parent drive.

domainName.description: Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for the user's device at the time the event is recorded.  If the device is unable to resolve the domain name of the host, it reports the IP address of the host.

emailDlpPolicyNames.description: The name of the DLP policy that matched on the email's file attachment.

emailFrom.description: The owner of the email account that matched on a DLP rule.

emailRecipients.description: The CC and BCC recipients included on the email that matched on a DLP rule.

emailSender.description: The individual who sent the email. This is often, but not always, the owner of the email account that matched on a DLP rule.

emailSubject.description: The subject of the email that matched on a DLP rule.

eventId.description: The unique identifier for the event.

eventTimestamp.description: Date and time that the Code42 service on the device detected an event; based on the device’s system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

eventType.description: Indicates the type of file event observed.

exposure.description: Lists indicators that the data may be exposed. Default is `[]`.

fieldErrors.description: List fields with errors indicating why they could not be determined.

fileCategory.description: A categorization of the file that is inferred from MIME type.

fileCategoryByBytes.description: A categorization of the file based on its contents.

fileCategoryByExtension.description: A categorization of the file based on its extension.

fileClassifications.description: Data provided by an external file classification vendor.

fileId.description: Unique identifier reported by the cloud provider for the file associated with the event.

fileName.description: The name of the file, including the file extension.

fileOwner.description: The name of the user who owns the file as reported by the device's file system.

filePath.description: The file location on the user's device; a forward or backslash must be included at the end of the filepath. Possibly null if the file event occurred on a cloud provider.

fileSize.description: Size of the file in bytes.

fileType.description: The type of file detected; only FILE types are searchable.

insertionTimestamp.description: Date and time that the event was received for indexing by Code42; timestamp is based on the Code42 server system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

md5Checksum.description: The MD5 hash of the file contents.

mimeTypeByBytes.description: The MIME type of the file based on its contents.

mimeTypeByExtension.description: The MIME type of the file based on its extension.

mimeTypeMismatch.description: Indicates whether or not the MIME type of the file based on its contents does not match the MIME type based on its extension and that this mismatch is unexpected.

modifyTimestamp.description: File modification timestamp as reported by the device's operating system.  This only indicates changes to file contents.  Changes to file permissions, file owner, or other metadata are not reflected in this timestamp.  Date is reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

operatingSystemUser.description: The username logged in to the device when the file activity was observed, as reported by the device’s operating system.

osHostName.description: The name reported by the device's operating system.  This may be different than the device name in the Code42 console.

outsideActiveHours.description: Indicates whether or not this event occurred outside of the user's typical active hours using data modeling from the this user's prior activity.

printJobName.description: For print events, the name of the print job, as reported by the user's device.

printerName.description: For print events, the name of the printer the job was sent to.

privateIpAddresses.description: The IP address of the user's device on your internal network, including Network interfaces, Virtual Network Interface controllers (NICs), and Loopback/non-routable addresses.

processName.description: The name of the process that accessed the file, as reported by the device’s operating system. Depending on your Code42 product plan, this value may be null for some event types.

processOwner.description: The username of the process owner, as reported by the device’s operating system. Depending on your Code42 product plan, this value may be null for some event types.

publicIpAddress.description: The external IP address of the user's device.

remoteActivity.description: For endpoint events, compares the IP address of the file event to your defined list of addresses in the Data Preferences section of the Code42 console. If the IP address from the file event does not match, "remote" is true. If the IP address does match, "remote" is false.

removableMediaBusType.description: For events detected on removable media, indicates the communication system used to transfer data between the host and the removable device.

removableMediaCapacity.description: For events detected on removable media, the capacity of the removable device in bytes.

removableMediaMediaName.description:
For events detected on removable media, the media name of the device, as reported by the vendor/device. This is usually very similar to the productName, but can vary based on the type of device. For example, if the device is a hard drive in a USB enclosure, this may be the combination of the drive model and the enclosure model.
This value is not provided by all devices, so it may be null in some cases.

removableMediaName.description: For events detected on removable media, the name of the removable device.

removableMediaPartitionId.description: For events detected on removable media, a unique identifier assigned to the volume/partition when it was formatted. Windows devices refer to this as the VolumeGuid. On Mac devices, this is the Disk / Partition UUID, which appears when running the Terminal command diskUtil info.

removableMediaSerialNumber.description: For events detected on removable media, the serial number of the removable device.

removableMediaVendor.description: For events detected on removable media, the vendor of the removable device.

removableMediaVolumeName.description: For events detected on removable media, the name assigned to the volume when it was formatted, as reported by the device's operating system. This is also frequently called the "partition" name.

riskIndicators.description: List of risk indicators identified for this event. If more than one risk indicator applies to this event, the sum of all indicators determines the total risk score.

riskScore.description: Sum of the weights for each risk indicator. This score is used to determine the overall risk severity of the event.

riskSeverity.description: The general risk assessment of the event, based on the numeric score.

sha256Checksum.description: The SHA256 hash of the file contents.

shared.description: Indicates the shared status as reported by the cloud provider at the time the event occurred. A shared file indicates that one or more users have been granted explicit access to the file. It does not capture whether or not a link to the file has been shared.

sharedWith.description: A list of users who have been granted explicit rights to the file at the time the event occurred.

sharingTypeAdded.description: Public sharing types that were added by this event.

source.description: Data source for a file event.

sourceCategory.description: General category of where the file originated. For example: Cloud Storage, Email, Social Media.

sourceName.description: Specific target of where the file originated. For example: Google Drive, Outlook, Slack.

sourceTabs.description: For events generated when a file is downloaded via a browser or other app, the tabs that had activity at the time of the event.

syncDestination.description: For events detected within a cloud storage sync destination on a device, the name of the cloud storage vendor.

syncDestinationUsername.description: For events detected within a cloud storage sync destination on a device, lists the usernames logged into the cloud storage provider when the file activity was observed.

tabUrl.description: For events generated when a file is read in a browser or other app, the URL that had activity at the time of the event. May not contain all URLs if multiple are present. 'tabs' field is recommended for use instead.

tabs.description: For events generated when a file is uploaded via a browser or other app, the tabs that had activity at the time of the event.

trustReason.description: The reason the event is trusted. trustReason is only populated if trusted is true for this event.

trusted.description: Indicates whether or not the file activity is trusted based on your Data Preferences settings.

url.description: URL reported by the cloud provider at the time the event occurred.

userUid.description: Unique identifier for the user of the Code42 app on the device. Null if the file event occurred on a cloud provider.

windowTitle.description: For events generated when a file is read in a browser or other app, the tab or window title(s) that had activity at the time of the event. 'tabs' field is recommended for use instead.

fileEvents.description: List of file events in the response.

nextPgToken.description: Use as the pgToken value in another request to indicate the starting point for additional page results. nextPgToken is null if there are no more results or if pgToken was not supplied.

problems.description: List of problems in the request.  A problem with a search request could be an invalid filter value, an operator that can't be used on a term, etc.

totalCount.description: Total number of file events in the response.

filterClause.description: Grouping clause for filters.  Default is `AND`.

filters.description: One or more SearchFilters to be combined in a query.

docCount.description: The approximate count of hits matching this value for your query.

value.description: The value of the term for this group.

groupClause.description: Grouping clause for any specified groups.  Default is `AND`.

groupingTerm.description: The search term to use to form the groups.

groups.description: One or more FilterGroups to be combined in a query.
The top groups based on the query and group by term.

problems.description: List of problems in the request.  A problem with a search request could be an invalid filter value, an operator that can't be used on a term, etc.

badFilter.description: The search filter that caused this problem.

description.example: Request timed out.  Refine your filter criteria and try again.

type.description: The type of problem that occured.

weight.description: Configured weight of the risk indicator at the time this event was seen.

apiVersion.description: Version of the API used to create the search.

columns.description: List of columns to be displayed in the web app for the search.

createdByUID.description: User UID of the user who created the saved search.

createdByUsername.description: Username of the user who created the saved search.

creationTimestamp.description: Time at which the saved search was created.

groupClause.description: Grouping clause for any specified groups.

groups.description: One or more FilterGroups to be combined in a query.

id.description: Unique identifier for the saved search.

modifiedByUID.description: User UID of the user who last modified the saved search.

modifiedByUsername.description: Username of the user who last modified the saved search.

modifiedTimestamp.description: Time at which the saved search was last modified.

name.description: Name given to the saved search.

searches.description: List of saved searches in the response.

operator.description: The type of match to perform.  Default value is `IS`.

term.description: The field to match.  Default value is `deviceUserName`.

operator.description: The type of match to perform.  Default value is `IS`.

term.description: The field to match.  Default value is `deviceUserName`.

groupClause.description: Grouping clause for any specified groups.  Default is `AND`.

groups.description: One or more FilterGroups to be combined in a query.

pgNum.description: Page number for search; ignored if pgToken is included.  Default is 1.

pgSize.description: Max number of results to return for a page.  Default is 100.

pgToken.description: A token used to indicate the starting point for additional page results. Typically, you obtain the pgToken value from the nextPgToken provided in a previous request. A pgToken is the only way to page past 10,000 results. If pgToken is supplied, pgNum is ignored. Provide empty string to retrieve the 'first page of results and null to use the pgNum value.  Default is null.

cloudUsername.description: Name of the user reported by the cloud provider with whom the file was shared.

title.description: The title of this app or browser tab.

titleError.description: Reason the title of this app or browser tab is unavailable.

url.description: The URL of this browser tab.

urlError.description: Reason the URL of this browser tab is unavailable.
